com.jjoe64.graphview.series

Class LineGraphSeries<E extends DataPointInterface>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jjoe64.graphview.series.BaseSeries<E>
      • com.jjoe64.graphview.series.LineGraphSeries<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Series<E>

    public class LineGraphSeries<E extends DataPointInterface>
extends BaseSeries<E>
    Series to plot the data as line. The line can be styled with many options.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  LineGraphSeries.Styles
      wrapped styles regarding the line

      • mDrawAsPath

        private boolean mDrawAsPath
        flag whether the line should be drawn as a path or with single drawLine commands (more performance) By default we use drawLine because it has much more peformance. For some styling reasons it can make sense to draw as path.

        public LineGraphSeries()
        creates a series without data

      • LineGraphSeries

        public LineGraphSeries(E[] data)
        creates a series with data
        Parameters:
        data - data points important: array has to be sorted from lowest x-value to the highest

        public int getThickness()

        public void setCustomPaint(android.graphics.Paint customPaint)
        custom paint that can be used. this will ignore the thickness and color styles.

      • setAnimated

        public void setAnimated(boolean animated)
        Parameters:
        animated - activate the animated rendering

      • isDrawAsPath

        public boolean isDrawAsPath()
        flag whether the line should be drawn as a path or with single drawLine commands (more performance) By default we use drawLine because it has much more peformance. For some styling reasons it can make sense to draw as path.

      • setDrawAsPath

        public void setDrawAsPath(boolean mDrawAsPath)
        flag whether the line should be drawn as a path or with single drawLine commands (more performance) By default we use drawLine because it has much more peformance. For some styling reasons it can make sense to draw as path.
        Parameters:
        mDrawAsPath - true to draw as path

      • appendData

        public void appendData(E dataPoint,
                       boolean scrollToEnd,
                       int maxDataPoints,
                       boolean silent)
        Overrides:
        appendData in class BaseSeries<E extends DataPointInterface>
        Parameters:
        dataPoint - values the values must be in the correct order! x-value has to be ASC. First the lowest x value and at least the highest x value.
        scrollToEnd - true => graphview will scroll to the end (maxX)
        maxDataPoints - if max data count is reached, the oldest data value will be lost to avoid memory leaks
        silent - set true to avoid rerender the graph

      • isAnimationActive

        private boolean isAnimationActive()
        Returns:
        currently animation is active
